recipe_name: Caramelised apple with red wine and mint sauce
author: Gino D'Acampo
method: For the caramelised apple, heat the butter in a frying pan and fry the apple slices until coloured on both sides. Remove the apple slices and set aside. Place the brown sugar, salt, red wine and orange juice into the same pan and heat until the sugar is dissolved and the liquid has reduced slightly to a syrupy sauce. Return the apple slices to the pan and warm through in the sauce. For the mint sauce, combine the ingredients in a bowl and stir well. To serve, arrange the apple slices in a spiral on a plate and spoon the red wine syrup over the top. Drizzle over the mint sauce, garnish with a sprig of mint and sprinkle with icing sugar.
ingredients: 15g/½oz butter,  1 cooking apple, sliced thinly,  40g/1½oz soft brown sugar,  pinch salt,  175ml/6fl oz red wine,  1 orange, juice only,  2 tbsp Greek-style yoghurt,  1 tsp clear honey,  2 tbsp chopped fresh mint,  1 fresh mint sprig,  icing sugar, to sprinkle
